chargeHist.descr: Sexual Assault of a Child Under 16 Years of Age
Sexual Assault of a Child Under 16 Years of Age

result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn A. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child [Modifiers: Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
plus 10% restitution surcharge.
50% of prison wages/assets to be applied to restitution

No contact with victim or her family
No contact with his daughter or anyone under the age of 18 without agents approval
No internet access without approval of agent
AMENDED 12/27/18: Internet use for work purposes only. No social media including, but not limited to: Craigslist, Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Snapchat, Instagram, Flickr, Meetup, Kik, and like-minded sites and/or applications. No chatrooms, no pornography.

Sex offender evaluation and follow all recommendations
Lifetime sex offender registration
Provide DNA sample and pay fee
Programming, counseling and treatment per agent

IT IS ORDERED, that the no-merit petition for review filed on December 5, 2019, by Attorney Susan E. Alesia on behalf of defendant-appellant, Shawn A. Anderson, is dismissed. 
(order dated 3/2/20)

IT IS ORDERED, that, on or before March 9, 2020, Shawn Anderson shall file either a written request to withdraw the no-merit petition for review or a supplemental petition in support of review.  If Shawn Anderson does not file either a written request to withdraw the no-merit petition for review or a supplemental petition, the court will proceed with considering the no-merit petition for review as filed.  Dated 02/10/2020.

Amended sentence credit. 
Amended to remove all but the DNA surcharge, restitution surcharges & the victim witness surcharge.
Amended internet use language.

Decision and Order on Defendant's Post-Conviction Motions
IT IS ORDERED:
1) Defendant is entitled to 245 days of sentence credit;
2) Judgment of Conviction is amended to remove all but the DNA surcharge, restitution surcharges & victim witness surcharge;
3) Judgment of Conviction is amended to replace internet language to the following: "Internet use for work purposes only. Not social media including, but not limited to: Craigslist, Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Snapchat, Instagram, Flickr, Meetup, Kik, and like-minded sites and/or applications. No chat rooms, no pornography."
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED
The Defendant's motion to withdraw the plea is denied.

Postconviction Motion Hearing, July 24, 2018

Exhibit #1 - DA's Pretrial Worksheet
Exhibit #2 - Guilty Plea Form

9:12am Defendant Shawn A. Anderson in custody in court with Attorney Susan Alesia. Ellen Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is sworn in and Court finds Defendant has waived attorney/client privilege with respect to Attorney Rivard freely and voluntarily. (Off record 9:20am - 9:33am) Parties stipulate to 245 days of jail credit; so ordered by Court. Parties stipulate to costs being limited to DNA surcharge, restitution and victim witness surcharge; Court orders. State to gather additional information/direction regarding altering a condition of Extended Supervision. State calls Attorney Rivard to the stand is sworn and testifies. Cross by Defense. Redirect by State. Defendant wishes to waive right to remain silent. Defendant remains sworn in and testifies. Cross by State. Court finds Defendant not credible as far as never having heard of lifetime supervision. Counsel to submit 1-2 page brief to Court. Stipulations from today and those held open to be put in writing by counsel.
